thread.title: German insurer bike theft payout up
thread.title_full: German insurer bike theft payout up

author: news.com.au
title: German insurer bike theft payout up
text:
GERMAN insurers paid out 100 million euros ($A149.62 million) in 2014 for stolen bicycles, 10 per cent more than the previous year, according to a report in Sunday's Die Welt newspaper.
"THE loss per damaged third party is on average 490 euros," Die Welt Quote: d Alexander Kuesel, leader of the German Insurance Federation's (GDV) risk management division, as saying.
The payments covered 210,000 stolen bicycles that were insured and was the highest amount for five years, the report said. Police recorded 340,000 stolen bicycles in 2014, an increase of 7.2 per cent on 2013. Only 9.6 per cent of the thefts were recovered. The chairman of the German Bicycle Club (ADFC), Ulrich Syberg, told the newspaper, "Bike theft is a mass crime that the police are trivialising." Politicians said that organised gangs were stealing the bicycles and they advised owners to protect their property better.
